newsitem.title: USA: Kitty Hawk, Kalitta to merge.
newsitem.headline: Kitty Hawk, Kalitta to merge.

text.p: Kalitta Cos, a group of air cargo companies, said Friday it has signed a letter of intent to be acquired by Kitty Hawk Inc.

Under the proposed combination, Conrad Kalitta, Kalitta Cos sole owner, would receive both cash and Kitty Hawk common stock as well as a significant management role in the combined entity, Kalitta said.
According to the proposal, the Kalitta Cos would continue without material change before and after the closing of the deal, Kalitta said.

Any combination would be conditioned on negotiation and execution of a mutually satisfactory definitive agreement, obtaining equity and debt financing by Dallas-based Kitty Hawk, satisfaction of customary closing conditions, and receipt of certain regulatory approvals, Kalitta said.
Kalitta also said Friday it has agreed to sell Kitty Hawk 16 B-727 aircraft for about $51 million.
